alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carbon, northeastern Albany, northwestern Laramie, western Platte and Converse Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Antelope Hills to 8 miles southwest of Glenrock to 12 miles west of Garrett to 9 miles south of Rock River. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rock River, Rolling Hills Estates, Esterbrook, Friend Park Campground, Curtis Gulch Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Laprele Reservoir, Windy Peak, Deer Creek, Garrett, Boxelder, Wheatland Reservoir 3, Campbell Creek Campground, Little Medicine School and Harris Park. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 124 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
